{"step_by_step_thinking": "Microangiopathic hemolytic anemia is a subgroup of hemolytic anemia caused by factors in the small blood vessels. It is characterized by anemia and the presence of schistocytes on blood film microscopy. TTP (thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura) is a type of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia. ITP (immune thrombocytopenic purpura) and senile purpura are not types of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia.
